meanings.definition: To formally declare one's abandonment or rejection of something.
meanings.sent1: She decided to renunciate her membership in the club.
meanings.sent2: He will renunciate his inheritance to show his disapproval.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to renunciate its interest in the toy as soon as it saw a shiny object.
meanings.sent4: The old tree seemed to renunciate its leaves early this year, as if tired of the changing seasons.
meanings.sent5: The student had to renunciate his favorite subject due to scheduling conflicts.

meanings.definition: A person who has formally renounced a belief or claim.
meanings.sent1: She became a renunciate after leaving the religious group.
meanings.sent2: The renunciate spoke about his journey to self-discovery.
meanings.sent3: The renunciate's calm demeanor was a stark contrast to his previous life.
meanings.sent4: The renunciate's presence in the community brought a sense of peace and wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The renunciate's simple lifestyle inspired many to seek inner peace.

meanings.definition: To give up or resign from a position or responsibility.
meanings.sent1: He had to renunciate his role as team captain due to injury.
meanings.sent2: She will renunciate her duties to focus on her family.
meanings.sent3: The CEO decided to renunciate his title and retire early.
meanings.sent4: The politician's scandal forced him to renunciate his office.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to renunciate her role as class monitor to take care of her sick pet.
